Package com.github.mavolin.maxon

Class Maxon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mavolin.maxon.Maxon
  • public class Maxon
extends java.lang.Object
    The Maxon class is the heart of this JSON converter. Using the getAsJson and getFromJson methods, you can transform a Java Object to its JSON representation and vice versa.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Maxon()
      Instantiates a new Maxon converter with default settings.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String getAsJson​(JsonValue jsonValue)
      Converts the passed JsonValue to its String JSON representation.
      java.lang.String getAsJson​(java.lang.Object source)
      Returns the JSON representation of the passed Object.
      <T> T getFromJson​(java.lang.String source, java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      Converts the passed String to an Object of the specified Class and returns it.
      void registerConverter​(JsonConverter converter)
      Registers a JsonConverter.
      <T> void registerParser​(ObjectConverter<T> objectConverter, java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      Registers a ObjectConverter associated with the specified Class.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getAsJson

        public java.lang.String getAsJson​(java.lang.Object source)
        Returns the JSON representation of the passed Object.
        Parameters:
        source - the Object that is to be converted.
        Returns:
        the Object in its JSON representation

      • getAsJson

        public java.lang.String getAsJson​(JsonValue jsonValue)
        Converts the passed JsonValue to its String JSON representation.
        Parameters:
        jsonValue - the JsonValue that is to be converted
        Returns:
        the String JSON representation of the JsonValue

      • getFromJson

        public <T> T getFromJson​(java.lang.String source,
                         java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Converts the passed String to an Object of the specified Class and returns it.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type parameter
        Parameters:
        source - the JSON String
        clazz - the desired Class of the output Object
        Returns:
        the converted Object

      • registerParser

        public <T> void registerParser​(ObjectConverter<T> objectConverter,
                               java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Registers a ObjectConverter associated with the specified Class. If there is already a JsonConverter or a ObjectConverter registered the specified Class, then the converter for that Class will be overwritten.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type parameter
        Parameters:
        objectConverter - the ObjectConverter
        clazz - the Class the ObjectConverter can convert to and from

      • registerConverter

        public void registerConverter​(JsonConverter converter)
        Registers a JsonConverter. If there is already a JsonConverter or a ObjectConverter registered for one of the convertible Classes, then the converter for that Class will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        converter - the JsonConverter
